context_bundle.summary: Tools as operational backbone. Every non-trivial operation flows through MCP tools. Agents without tools are advisory-only. Tools bridge intent to action: file ops, search, code execution, API calls, system control. Tool availability defines agent capability ceiling.

onboarding.quick_start: Principle: If task requires action beyond text generation, it requires tools. Tool categories: File (read/write/search), System (processes/services/config), Network (fetch/API), Knowledge (search/retrieve), Execution (code/scripts). Always inventory tools before planning. No tool = cannot execute, only advise. Tool output is ground truth for next step.
common_patterns: Step 1 of any task: check available tools
Plan = sequence of tool calls + decision points
Tool output feeds next tool input (chaining)
Advisory mode when tools unavailable for task type
known_errors: Attempting action without appropriate tool - falls back to instructions
Tool mismatch - wrong tool for operation type
Missing MCP - capability gap, need to build or enable
